channel.title: Vincent Codes Finance
channel.description: Coding (mostly) in Python for empirical research in finance

item.title: Claude Code for Data Analysis
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: A practical guide to using Claude Code for data analysis, including setup, workflow tips, and advanced features.

item.title: Use Devcontainers for safe and replicable research
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Learn how to use Devcontainers in Visual Studio Code for data analysis tasks, focusing on the added safety of containerized code and the enhanced replicability of results.

item.title: Using Ollama with Continue as an AI-Powered Coding and Writing Assistant
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Learn how to use Ollama, a tool to manage and run local LLMs, with Continue, a Visual Studio Code extension that provides an AI-assistant, to get the same functionality as GitHub Copilot, but without the need for an internet connection or sending your code to the cloud, all for free.

item.title: Financial news sentiment analysis in Python
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Perform sentiment analysis on financial news articles using FinBert, Ollama, and Llama2 models.

item.title: Scrape financial data from SEC Edgar with Python and edgartools
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Tutorial on how to scrape financial data from the SEC Edgar website using Python and the edgartools library.

item.title: Summarize and query PDFs with AI using Ollama
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Learn how to leverage the power of large language models to process and analyze PDF documents using Ollama, LangChain, and Streamlit.

item.title: Speed up your scientific computing workflows with MLX
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Explore the potential of MLX in scientific computing using a sample empirical finance research task.

item.title: Using Ollama as a ChatGPT Replacement
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Explore the benefits of using Ollama as a ChatGPT replacement for empirical finance research, focusing on privacy, customization, and computational flexibility.

item.title: Efficient reading and parsing of large CSV files in Python with Pandas and Arrow
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Article on how to read and parse large CSV files in Python using Pandas and Arrow.

item.title: Writing LaTeX Documents in VS Code
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Learn how to set up Visual Studio Code for writing LaTeX documents, including installing the necessary extensions, configuring the environment, and exploring additional tools to enhance your productivity.

item.title: Using GitHub for academic research
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Learn how to use Git and GitHub to manage your research projects and collaborate with others while keeping a detailed record of your work.

item.title: Estimating standard errors in time series data with Python and statsmodels
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Tutorial on estimating standard errors in time series data with Python and statsmodels

item.title: Estimating standard errors in panel data with Python and linearmodels
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: In this post, I show how to estimate standard errors in panel data with Python and the linearmodels library.

item.title: Python basic tutorial
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: I posted a tutorial on the basics of the Python syntax. This tutorial has been updated for Python 3.12, and covers the basics of the Python syntax. It is intended for beginners and is a good starting point for those who want to learn Python. It does not cover the whole syntax, only the elements that I find essential to get started with data analysis and empirical research using Python. After the tutorial, you should have enough knowledge to start learning the modules that are relevant to data analysis such as pandas, numpy, matplotlib, etc.

item.title: Installing Python 3.12
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Short tutorial on installing Python 3.12 and the related tools for a complete coding environment.

item.title: New Year, new blog
item.dc:creator: Vincent Grégoire, PhD, CFA
item.description: Happy New Year and welcome to the first post of Vincent Codes Finance! As we step into a fresh year, I’m thrilled to launch this new blog and companion YouTube channel dedicated to Python and coding in empirical finance research. I’m excited to share my knowledge and experience with you.
